Description: Fragment of wall and foot of East Greek pottery plate; ring foot. On the slipped interior two zones preserved: above, set of verticals; below, buds. Added red on angular bud and on middle bar; added red and white on the band separating the friezes. On the clay ground of the exterior, one band of black and one of dilute glaze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 28, no. 99 pl. 27)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.128)
